The Man on the Moon watched Earth with a sigh, his silver suit shimmering under the stars. He had once been a dreamer, a poet who gazed at the night sky, longing to explore its depths. But now, he was alone, surrounded by the cold silence of space. Each night, he listened to the whispers of humanity, their hopes and fears carried on the cosmic winds. He painted their stories in stardust, creating constellations that told of love, loss, and laughter. One day, he vowed, he would descend and share his celestial tales, reminding Earth that dreams could bridge even the greatest distances.
